column1: #Text=Very early the next morning , before the first peep of the day , Dick arose , changed his garments , armed himself once more like a gentleman , and set forth for Lawless 's den in the forest .

#Text=There , it will be remembered , he had left Lord Foxham 's papers ; and to get these and be back in time for the tryst with the young Duke of Gloucester could only be managed by an early start and the most vigorous walking .
#Text=The frost was more rigorous than ever ; the air windless and dry , and stinging to the nostril .
#Text=The moon had gone down , but the stars were still bright and numerous , and the reflection from the snow was clear and cheerful .
#Text=There was no need for a lamp to walk by ; nor , in that still but ringing air , the least temptation to delay .

#Text=Dick had crossed the greater part of the open ground between Shoreby and the forest , and had reached the bottom of the little hill , some hundred yards below the Cross of St. Bride , when , through the stillness of the black morn , there rang forth the note of a trumpet , so shrill , clear , and piercing , that he thought he had never heard the match of it for audibility .
#Text=It was blown once , and then hurriedly a second time ; and then the clash of steel succeeded .
#Text=At this young Shelton pricked his ears , and drawing his sword , ran forward up the hill .
#Text=Presently he came in sight of the cross , and was aware of a most fierce encounter raging on the road before it .

#Text=There were seven or eight assailants , and but one to keep head against them ; but so active and dexterous was this one , so desperately did he charge and scatter his opponents , so deftly keep his footing on the ice , that already , before Dick could intervene , he had slain one , wounded another , and kept the whole in check .
#Text=Still , it was by a miracle that he continued his defence , and at any moment , any accident , the least slip of foot or error of hand , his life would be a forfeit .
#Text=" Hold ye well , sir ! Here is help !
#Text=" he shouted , as he fell upon the rear of the assailants .

#Text= said the hero of the trumpet ; and when his order had been obeyed , he drew near to Dick and looked him in the face .

_	_	_	_

#Text= My lord , " returned Dick , with a faint sense that he was in the presence of a great personage , " ye are yourself so marvellous a good swordsman that I believe ye had managed them single-handed .

_	_	_	_

#Text= How knew ye who I was ?

#Text= Even now , my lord , " Dick answered , " I am ignorant of whom I speak with .

#Text= And yet ye threw yourself head first into this unequal battle .

_	_	_	_

#Text= I saw one man valiantly contending against many , " replied Dick , " and I had thought myself dishonoured not to bear him aid .
